greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Expansion of (1 - x + 2*x^2 + x^3) / ((1 - x) * (1 - x^3)) in powers of x.
comment: An order 2 permutation of nonnegative integers.
link: Vincenzo Librandi, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..1000
Index entries for linear recurrences with constant coefficients, signature (1,0,1,-1).
formula: a(n) = a(n-1) + 3*(n^2 mod 3) - 1, with a(0)=1. [_Paolo P. Lava_, Feb 14 2014]
a(n) = n - 1 + mod(n-1, 3). - _Wesley Ivan Hurt_, Aug 21 2014
maple: for n from 0 to q do a:=a+3*(n^2 mod 3)-1; print(a);
od; end: P(100); # _Paolo P. Lava_, Feb 14 2014
mathematica: LinearRecurrence[{1, 0, 1, -1}, {1, 0, 2, 4}, 80] (* or *) CoefficientList[Series[(1 - x + 2 x^2 + x^3) / ((1 - x) (1 -x^3)), {x, 0, 80}], x] (* _Vincenzo Librandi_, Sep 28 2017 *)
program: (MAGMA) [n-1+((n-1) mod 3) : n in [0..100]]; // _Wesley Ivan Hurt_, Aug 21 2014
(MAGMA) I:=[1,0,2,4]; [n le 4 select I[n] else Self(n-1)+Self(n-3)-Self(n-4): n in [1..80]]; // _Vincenzo Librandi_, Sep 28 2017
results.author: _Michael Somos_, Jan 23 2014
